==Events==
*  [[37]] &ndash; The [[Roman Senate]] annuls [[Tiberius]]'s will and proclaims [[Caligula]] emperor.
* [[235]] &ndash; Emperor [[Alexander Severus]] and his mother [[Julia Avita Mamaea|Julia Mamaea]] are [[murder]]ed by [[Roman legionary|legionaries]] near Mogontiacum (modern [[Mainz]]), ending the [[Severan dynasty]].
* [[633]] &ndash; [[Ridda Wars]]: The [[Arabian Peninsula]] is united under the central authority of Caliph [[Abu Bakr]].
*[[1229]] &ndash; [[Frederick II, Holy Roman Emperor]], declares himself [[King of Jerusalem]] in the [[Sixth Crusade]].
*[[1241]] &ndash; [[First Mongol invasion of Poland]]: [[Mongol Empire|Mongols]] overwhelm [[History of Poland (966–1385)|Polish]] armies in [[Kraków]] in the [[Battle of Chmielnik]] and plunder the city.
*[[1314]] &ndash; [[Jacques de Molay]], the 23rd and the last Grand Master of the [[Knights Templar]], is burned at the stake.
*[[1438]] &ndash; [[Albert II of Habsburg]] becomes [[Holy Roman Emperor]].
*[[1608]] &ndash; [[Susenyos of Ethiopia|Susenyos]] is formally crowned Emperor of [[Ethiopia]].
*[[1644]] &ndash; The [[Anglo-Powhatan Wars|Third Anglo-Powhatan War]] begins in the [[Colony of Virginia]].
*[[1741]] &ndash; New York governor [[George Clarke (governor)|George Clarke]]'s complex at [[Fort Amsterdam|Fort George]] is burned in an arson attack, starting the [[New York Conspiracy of 1741]].
*[[1766]] &ndash; [[American Revolution]]: The [[British Parliament]] repeals the [[Stamp Act 1765|Stamp Act]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; The first [[republic]] in Germany, the [[Republic of Mainz]], is declared by [[Andreas Joseph Hofmann]].
*[[1834]] &ndash; [[Tolpuddle Martyrs|Six farm labourers]] from [[Tolpuddle]], [[Dorset]], England are sentenced to be transported to Australia for forming a [[trade union]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[Revolutions of 1848 in the German states|March Revolution]]: in Berlin there is a struggle between citizens and military, costing about 300 lives.
*[[1850]] &ndash; [[American Express]] is founded by [[Henry Wells]] and [[William Fargo]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Congress of the Confederate States]] adjourns for the last time.
*[[1871]] &ndash; Declaration of the [[Paris Commune]]; President of the French Republic, [[Adolphe Thiers]], orders the evacuation of Paris.
*[[1874]] &ndash; Hawaii signs a treaty with the United States granting exclusive [[trade]] rights.
*[[1892]] &ndash; Former Governor General [[Frederick Stanley, 16th Earl of Derby|Lord Stanley]] pledges to donate a [[silver]] challenge cup, later named after him, as an award for the best [[ice hockey|hockey]] team in Canada the [[Stanley Cup]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[Traian Vuia]] flies a heavier-than-air [[aircraft]] for 11 meters at an altitude of one meter.
*[[1913]] &ndash; King [[George I of Greece]] is [[assassination|assassinated]] in the recently liberated city of [[Thessaloniki]].
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: During the [[Battle of Gallipoli]], three [[battleship]]s are sunk during a failed British and French [[Naval operations in the Dardanelles Campaign|naval attack on the Dardanelles]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; The second [[Peace of Riga]] is signed between Poland and the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; In India, [[Mohandas Gandhi]] is sentenced to six years in [[prison]] for [[civil disobedience]]. He serves only 2 years.
*[[1925]] &ndash; The [[Tri-State Tornado]] hits the Midwestern states of [[Missouri]], [[Illinois]], and [[Indiana]], killing 695 people.
*[[1937]] &ndash; The [[New London School explosion]] in [[New London, Texas]], kills 300 people, mostly children.
*  1937   &ndash; [[Spanish Civil War]]: Spanish Republican forces defeat the [[Italy|Italians]] at the [[Battle of Guadalajara]].
*  1937   &ndash; The [[human-powered aircraft]], ''[[Bossi-Bonomi Pedaliante|Pedaliante]]'', flies {{convert|1|km}} outside [[Milan]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; Mexico nationalizes all foreign-owned [[petroleum|oil]] properties within its borders.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Axis Powers]] &ndash; [[Adolf Hitler]] and [[Benito Mussolini]] meet at the [[Brenner Pass]] in the [[Alps]] and agree to form an alliance against France and the United Kingdom.
*[[1942]] &ndash; The [[War Relocation Authority]] is established in the United States to take Japanese Americans into custody.
*[[1944]] &ndash; The eruption of [[Mount Vesuvius]] in Italy kills 26 people and causes thousands to flee their homes.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: 1,250 American bombers attack Berlin.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Diplomatic relations]] between [[Switzerland]] and the [[Soviet Union]] are established.
*[[1948]] &ndash; Soviet consultants leave Yugoslavia in the first sign of the [[Tito-Stalin split]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; An [[1953 Yenice-Gönen earthquake|earthquake]] hits western [[Turkey]], killing 265 people.
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] signs a bill into law allowing for Hawaiian statehood, which would become official on [[August 21]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Evian Accords]] end the [[Algerian War of Independence]], which had begun in 1954.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Astronaut|Cosmonaut]] [[Aleksei Leonov]], leaving his spacecraft [[Voskhod 2]] for 12 minutes, becomes the first person to [[Extra-vehicular activity|walk in space]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[supertanker]] {{SS|Torrey Canyon||2}} runs aground off the Cornish coast.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Gold standard]]: The [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] repeals the requirement for a gold reserve to back [[United States dollar|US currency]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; The United States begins [[Operation Menu|secretly bombing]] the [[Sihanouk Trail]] in [[Cambodia]], used by [[People's Army of Vietnam|communist forces]] to infiltrate [[South Vietnam]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Lon Nol]] ousts Prince [[Norodom Sihanouk]] of [[Cambodia]].
*  1970   &ndash; The [[U.S. postal strike of 1970]] begins, one of the largest [[Wildcat strike action|wildcat strikes]] in U.S. history.
*[[1971]] &ndash; In [[Peru]] a [[landslide]] crashes into [[Yanawayin Lake]], killing 200 people at the mining camp of Chungar.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Oil embargo crisis]]: Most [[OPEC]] nations end a five-month oil [[embargo]] against the United States, Europe and Japan.
*[[1980]] &ndash; At [[Plesetsk Cosmodrome]] in Russia, 50 people are killed by an explosion of a [[Vostok rocket|Vostok-2M]] rocket on its launch pad during a fueling operation.
*[[1985]] &ndash; First episode of [[Neighbours]] broadcast.
*[[1990]] &ndash; Germans in the [[German Democratic Republic]] vote in the [[East German general election, 1990|first democratic elections]] in the former communist dictatorship.
*  1990   &ndash; In the largest [[art theft]] in US history, 12 paintings, collectively worth around $300&nbsp;million, are stolen from the [[Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum]] in [[Boston, Massachusetts]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; In a national referendum white South Africans vote overwhelmingly in favour of ending the racist policy of [[Apartheid]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia]]'s [[Bosniaks]] and [[Croats]] sign the [[Washington Agreement]], ending war between the [[Croatian Republic of Herzeg-Bosnia]] and the [[Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina]], and establishing the [[Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; A [[Ozone Disco Club fire|nightclub fire]] in [[Quezon City]], [[Philippines]] kills 162 people.
*[[1997]] &ndash; The tail of a Russian [[Antonov An-24]] charter plane breaks off while en route to Turkey causing the plane to crash and killing all 50 people on board and leading to the grounding of all An-24s.
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Tupou VI]] becomes [[List of monarchs of Tonga|King of Tonga]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; The parliaments of [[Russia]] and [[Crimea]] sign an [[Treaty on the Adoption of the Republic of Crimea to Russia|accession treaty]].
